name: Artemis
description: "Artemis is a low-code solution revolutionizing IoT dev by streamlining process, promoting innovation, improving scalability & reliability, supporting latest Web3 standards. Create new devices faster & with more ease, resulting in faster time-to-market & efficient dev & maintenance. #IoT #Web3"

userContent.contentManagement: Content is NOT collected NOT stored and NOT distributed.

dataPrivacySecurity.collectsPII: PII data is NOT collected NOT stored and NOT distributed.

otherDeploymentOrganisations: Artemis is designed for developers who create and maintain IoT devices. It can be used by software developers

and IoT developers who want to simplify the development process for IoT devices. It can also be used by organizations and companies that are involved in the development and production of IoT devices. Additionally

it can be used by researchers and academics who are working in the field of IoT.

Artemis can be used by a wide range of professionals and organizations working in the IoT industry. This includes:

- Software developers and engineers who are responsible for creating and maintaining the software that runs on IoT devices.
- Embedded engineers and firmware developers who are responsible for designing and implementing the hardware and software that run on IoT devices.
- IoT developers who are responsible for creating new IoT solutions and products.
- Product managers and designers who are responsible for creating and launching new IoT products.
- Researchers and academics who are working on new IoT technologies and solutions.
- Organizations and companies that are involved in the development

and deployment of IoT devices.

Artemis can be used by organizations of any size
from small startups to large enterprises

and in any industry where IoT is used.

We are currently collaborating with multiple companies to accelerate the acquisition of our first customers following the launch.

clearOwnership.clearOwnershipName: We are delighted to announce that Mohammad Al-Soub and Omar Abusalim are the proprietors of this platform, which was expertly crafted by the Artemis team located in Amman, Jordan.
clearOwnership.clearOwnershipURL: The ownership of the platform appears through the statement shown at the bottom of the official project website

openStandards:
Security
WPA2
HTTPS

Authentication & Authorization
we use a basic authentication mechanism using a username and password for the connection to the broker

web standards

Data Exchange/ Configuration formats
MQTT subscribe/publish
normal HTTP format 
json
bestPractices: Open-source: Artemis is completely open-source and free to use

allowing for transparency and community-driven development.

Low-code: Artemis simplifies the process of creating and maintaining IoT devices through its low-code solution

making it accessible to developers of all skill levels.

Scalability and reliability: Artemis improves the scalability and reliability of IoT systems

resulting in more robust and dependable infrastructure overall.

Communication protocols: Artemis uses open-source solutions such as Google Blocky and Arduino

MQTT for communication to make IoT development easier.

Support for the latest web 3 standards: Artemis powers in the Web 3 standards
a peer-to-peer hypermedia protocol designed to preserve and grow humanity's knowledge by making the web upgradeable

and more open.

Security: Artemis provides a more secure

and open web environment that will preserve and grow humanity's knowledge.

Education: Artemis uses educational methods to make real products and provides not only a powerful tool for developers to create advanced and innovative IoT devices quickly and easily

but also an infrastructure that supports the latest Web 3 standards

Flexibility: Artemis is compatible with different platforms like WordPress

Elemntor and it is planned to support React JS and React Native in the future.

Adherence to these best practices and principles can be demonstrated through our open-source codebase
and support for communication protocols. Additionally
our adherence to the latest web 3 standards is evident in the way our solution promotes scalability and reliability in IoT systems.

sdgs.relevance:
Artemis, as a low-code solution for IoT developers, can potentially support Sustainable
Development Goals (SDGs) in several ways:
SDG 9 (Industry, Innovation, and Infrastructure): By streamlining the development
process for IoT devices, Artemis can help to accelerate innovation in the field of IoT
and promote the development of more robust and reliable infrastructure :
Accelerating Innovation: By providing a low-code solution for IoT developers, Artemis can
make it easier for developers to create new IoT solutions, allowing for more experimentation
and innovation in the field of IoT. This can help to promote the growth of the IoT industry and
create new opportunities for innovation.
Improving Infrastructure: Artemis can help to improve the scalability and reliability of IoT
systems by making it easier to develop and maintain the software that runs on IoT devices.
This can lead to more robust and reliable IoT systems overall, which can support the
development of more resilient and sustainable infrastructure.
Enhancing Industry Efficiency: Artemis can support streamlining the development process
for IoT devices, leading to faster time-to-market, and more efficient development and
maintenance, which can help to increase the efficiency and competitiveness of the IoT
industry.
Fostering Entrepreneurship: Artemis can enable entrepreneurs and small businesses to
create IoT solutions without needing to spend as much time on the software development
aspect, which can foster the growth of small and medium-sized enterprises, which can be
crucial for economic growth and job creation.
Supporting Digitalization: By making it easier to develop IoT solutions, Artemis can support
the digitalization of various industries and sectors, leading to more efficient, productive and
sustainable industries, which can be beneficial for global economic growth and development.
SDG 11 (Sustainable Cities and Communities): Artemis can help to develop smart
cities and communities by enabling the creation of IoT solutions that can improve the
management of resources and services, such as energy, water, and transportation.
can support the achievement of Sustainable Development Goal 11 (SDG 11) which aims to
"make cities and human settlements inclusive, safe, resilient and sustainable" by enabling
the faster and more efficient development of IoT solutions that improve the lives of people in
urban areas.
One way Artemis can support SDG 11 is by enabling the development of IoT solutions that
improve the energy efficiency of buildings. For example, by using IoT sensors and devices,
buildings can monitor and optimize their energy consumption, leading to reduced energy
consumption, and lower carbon emissions.
Another way Artemis can support SDG 11 is by enabling the development of IoT solutions
that improve public transportation. For example, by using IoT sensors and devices, public
transportation systems can be made more efficient and reliable, leading to reduced traffic
congestion and improved mobility for citizens.
Artemis can also support SDG 11 by enabling the development of IoT solutions that improve
the safety and security of cities. For
Furthermore, Artemis can support the development of smart city applications, such as smart
lighting, smart parking, and smart waste management. With the help of these IoT solutions,
cities can be more efficient, sustainable, and livable.
In conclusion, Artemis can support the achievement of SDG 11 by enabling the faster and
more efficient development of IoT solutions that improve the energy efficiency of buildings,
public transportation, safety and security, and smart city applications in urban areas.
SDG 12 (Responsible Consumption and Production): Artemis can help to create IoT
solutions that can improve the efficiency and sustainability of production and
consumption, such as by reducing
One way Artemis can support SDG 12 is by enabling the development of IoT solutions that
monitor and optimize resource consumption in various industries such as manufacturing,
agriculture, and mining. For example, by using IoT sensors and devices, these industries
can track and manage their resource consumption in real time, leading to more efficient and
sustainable use of resources.
Another way Artemis can support SDG 12 is by enabling the development of IoT solutions
that improve recycling and waste management. For example, by using IoT sensors and
devices, cities and municipalities can improve their waste collection and recycling processes,
leading to reduced waste and more efficient use of resources.
Artemis can also support the development of IoT solutions that can monitor the
environmental impact of consumer products, such as tracking the carbon footprint of
products throughout their lifecycle, from production to disposal.
Furthermore, Artemis can support the development of IoT solutions that can monitor the
environmental impact of industrial activities such as monitoring the water and air quality, and
waste management in industrial sites.
In conclusion, Artemis can support the achievement of SDG 12 by enabling the faster and
more efficient development of IoT solutions that monitor and optimize resource consumption,
reduce waste and improve recycling in various industries and cities, and also monitor the
environmental impact of consumer products and industrial activities.
Overall, Artemis can enable the development of IoT solutions that can contribute to the
achievement of multiple SDGs, depending on the specific application and implementation
.
note there is a pug in dbg website so the application not taken SDG 9 but we mention it here

privacy.privacyCompliance: All rules and laws in the GDPR are applied in Artemis project apply, as the project's policy and work mechanism have been reviewed and compared by the private project's lawyer.
